dialogueTree.title: Shivers: "All around you, rain falls on the g..."
dialogueTree.text: All around you, rain falls on the great city of Revachol. Rain drips from the eaves and floods the gutters, washing the filth away.

links.title: Shivers: "Winter's grip on the city is loosen..."
links.text: Winter's grip on the city is loosening. The spring thaw is here.

links.title: You: "Finally. What now?"
links.text: Finally. What now?

links.title: Shivers: "Humid. Your coat shields you from t..."
links.text: Humid. Your coat shields you from the rain while the city shivers around you.

links.title: You: "What is in the west?"
links.text: What is in the west?

links.title: Shivers: "Sheets of rain over the water. A fl..."
links.text: Sheets of rain over the water. A flight of stairs leading into the ocean. Wave after wave washing the coast of Martinaise, with its motorboats and gently swaying reeds.

links.title: Shivers: "The ruins of a half-sunken seafort..."
links.text: The ruins of a half-sunken seafort crumble on an inlet. Beyond the Bay of Revachol, ghosts rise into the sky.

links.title: You: "Who are you, ghosts?"
links.text: Who are you, ghosts?

links.title: Shivers: "The skyscrapers of La Delta, the fi..."
links.text: The skyscrapers of La Delta, the financial district. Faint golden light seeps from the office windows.

links.title: Inland Empire: "Will you ever go there?"
links.text: Will you ever go there?

links.title: You: "Will I?"
links.text: Will I?

links.title: Shivers: "No. You are just one of the hundred..."
links.text: No. You are just one of the hundreds of thousands who watch them rise across the bay from Martinaise every day.

links.title: You: "Let go of the feeling."
links.text: Let go of the feeling.

links.title: Shivers: "Your hair sticks to your forehead,..."
links.text: Your hair sticks to your forehead, cold and wet.

links.title: You: "What is down the shore?"
links.text: What is down the shore?

links.title: Shivers: "Urban coastline, rain dripping off..."
links.text: Urban coastline, rain dripping off eternite-covered roofs. Cinder blocks left over from half-finished construction. A defunct research and development building once seized by revolutionaries. An old wooden church stands on stilts above the water.

links.title: You: "And beyond that?"
links.text: And beyond that?

links.title: Shivers: "Coal City, end of all lines."
links.text: Coal City, end of all lines.

links.title: You: "Run your fingers through your dampe..."
links.text: Run your fingers through your dampened hair.

links.title: Shivers: "Your hair is an oily mess flecked w..."
links.text: Your hair is an oily mess flecked with ash from neighbouring coal plants. Smoke stacks rise somewhere in the distance.

links.title: You: "What's in the east?"
links.text: What's in the east?

links.title: Composure: "There's a Frittte on the corner. A..."
links.text: There's a Frittte on the corner. A plastic coat is folded into a small triangle under the counter by the window. Beyond that, the strikebreakers have gathered.

links.title: Shivers: "The great gates of the industrial h..."
links.text: The great gates of the industrial harbour are locked. A chill runs down your back. You shudder like an animal trying to shake water from its hide.

links.title: You: "Clench your teeth to stop shudderin..."
links.text: Clench your teeth to stop shuddering.

links.title: Shivers: "Behind the gates -- heaps of supply..."
links.text: Behind the gates -- heaps of supply crates. Red and blue metal shipping containers slick with rain. The Greater Revachol Industrial Harbour is an artificial mountain range. Immense wealth resides within, and immeasurable poverty in its shadow.

links.title: You: "And beyond that?"
links.text: And beyond that?

links.title: Shivers: "La Drisienne, King Dris's Passenger..."
links.text: La Drisienne, King Dris's Passenger Harbour. Cruise ships flanked by dock arms. Cranes watching over the mouth of the river distributary.

links.title: You: "What is across the distributary?"
links.text: What is across the distributary?

links.title: Shivers: "Couron, the lower middle class. Dis..."
links.text: Couron, the lower middle class. Distributary after distributary cuts the city blocks in half. Seven-story buildings trail off into the rain.

links.title: You: "What is beyond the Couron?"
links.text: What is beyond the Couron?

links.title: Shivers: "A silvery curtain of rain over the..."
links.text: A silvery curtain of rain over the houses. The class divide.

links.title: Rhetoric: "You have never been there. They don..."
links.text: You have never been there. They don't need the law east of the river.

links.title: You: "And before that?"
links.text: And before that?

links.title: Shivers: "You -- on the Martinaise plaza. A s..."
links.text: You -- on the Martinaise plaza. A small dot looking up at the sky. Droplets form on your eyelashes.

links.title: You: "Shake your shoulders again."
links.text: Shake your shoulders again.

links.title: Shivers: "You shudder, looking down at your f..."
links.text: You shudder, looking down at your feet. Dirty rainwater runs veins into the plaza snow.

links.title: Shivers: "You realize you still have only one..."
links.text: You realize you still have only one shoe. Nearby, on the balcony of the Whirling-in-Rags hostel-cafeteria, a single crocodile-skin shoe now fills with rainwater.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: "From the corner of his eye, the lie..."
links.text: From the corner of his eye, the lieutenant gives your feet a worried glance. Rain drips from his glasses.

links.title: You: ""It's cool. I'm in control.""
links.text: "It's cool. I'm in control."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: "The lieutenant nods, then looks eas..."
links.text: The lieutenant nods, then looks east.

links.title: You: "What is there?"
links.text: What is there?

links.title: You: "Look up."
links.text: Look up.

links.title: You: ""I should probably do something abo..."
links.text: "I should probably do something about this."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: "The lieutenant nods, then looks eas..."
links.text: The lieutenant nods, then looks east.

links.title: You: "Say nothing."
links.text: Say nothing.

links.title: Shivers: "The rain falls."
links.text: The rain falls.

links.title: Shivers: "Two green snakeskin shoes stand at..."
links.text: Two green snakeskin shoes stand at attention on the mosaic paving of the plaza.

links.title: Shivers: "You realize you have no shoes on. Y..."
links.text: You realize you have no shoes on. Your feet are red with cold.

links.title: You: "What's in the north?"
links.text: What's in the north?

links.title: Shivers: "Capeside apartments -- tower blocks..."
links.text: Capeside apartments -- tower blocks crowd one another, 4.46 mm bullets still lodged in their war-torn stone walls.

links.title: Shivers: "Hallways collapsed from the mortar..."
links.text: Hallways collapsed from the mortar hits of a war that was lost long ago. Clotheslines go to waste in the rain. Radios play.

links.title: Rhetoric: "The morning news."
links.text: The morning news.

links.title: You: "And closer to here?"
links.text: And closer to here?

links.title: Shivers: "A yard. Rain falls onto the roof of..."
links.text: A yard. Rain falls onto the roof of a woodshed. The lingering odour of decomposition mixes with that of damp soil.

links.title: Shivers: "A yard. Rain falls onto the roof of..."
links.text: A yard. Rain falls onto the roof of a woodshed. Filthy water pools around a body. Droplets of rain slip from the dead man's cold cheeks.

links.title: Shivers: "A yard. Rain falls onto the roof of..."
links.text: A yard. Rain falls onto the roof of a woodshed. Coal leaks into a puddle beneath a dead man's feet. He swings from a tree, bloated. Droplets of rain slip from his cold cheeks.

links.title: Rhetoric: "The news at noon."
links.text: The news at noon.

links.title: Rhetoric: "The evening news."
links.text: The evening news.

links.title: Rhetoric: "Midnight news and reruns."
links.text: Midnight news and reruns.

links.title: You: "What's in the south?"
links.text: What's in the south?

links.title: Shivers: "A traffic jam. Rain thrumming on th..."
links.text: A traffic jam. Rain thrumming on the roofs of motor vehicles. Inside, drivers watch water streaming down their windshields. The statue of a king shudders, he too is cold. The canal bridge has been raised.

links.title: You: "What's on the other side?"
links.text: What's on the other side?

links.title: Shivers: "The road ascends; a raised motorway..."
links.text: The road ascends; a raised motorway loops above the ghetto. Beneath its concrete columns -- a sea of rooftops, woodwork, and tar stretches northward. Four-story buildings as far as the rain can fall. The snows melt in Jamrock.

links.title: You: "Where the hood, where the hood, whe..."
links.text: Where the hood, where the hood, where the hood at?

links.title: Shivers: "HAVE A BROTHER IN THE CUT. WHERE TH..."
links.text: HAVE A BROTHER IN THE CUT. WHERE THE WOOD AT?

links.title: You: "Why am I not there?"
links.text: Why am I not there?

links.title: Shivers: "To be in Martinaise, where no one g..."
links.text: To be in Martinaise, where no one goes. At the run-off point of a long-forgotten canal, in the whitest part of town. In the shadow of the day the Revolution failed.

links.title: You: "What am I doing here?"
links.text: What am I doing here?

links.title: Shivers: "Standing in the rain, looking north..."
links.text: Standing in the rain, looking north, where Jamrock Rock City stretches inland.

links.title: You: "Where do I live?"
links.text: Where do I live?

links.title: Shivers: "On a street there that flows like a..."
links.text: On a street there that flows like a muddy river in the snow, with fire traps rising on either side. A film rental opens its doors to the rain, an armoured motor carriage rushes past the corner where you used to walk together... Suddenly, the hair on your back rises.

links.title: Shivers: "YOU CANNOT RETURN."
links.text: YOU CANNOT RETURN.

links.title: You: "Shudder, look further..."
links.text: Shudder, look further...

links.title: Shivers: "In the rain-swept distance above th..."
links.text: In the rain-swept distance above the rooftops of Jamrock, a re-purposed silk mill stands perched above the motorway exit. Precinct 41 hunches in the rain.

links.title: Esprit de Corps: "Patrol Officer Judit Minot stands b..."
links.text: Patrol Officer Judit Minot stands beneath the awning overhanging the entrance, struggling to open her big black umbrella.

links.title: Nix Gottlieb: "The Precinct surgeon, chewing on a..."
links.text: The Precinct surgeon, chewing on a piece of candy, throws her a questioning glance, walking by: "Need a hand with that?"

links.title: Judit Minot: ""No. Thank you. I got it." She gets..."
links.text: "No. Thank you. I got it." She gets the umbrella to open, and, with a quick smile and nod to the surgeon, sprints down the steps. The rain falls all around her...

links.title: Esprit de Corps: "Satellite-Officer Jean Vicquemare r..."
links.text: Satellite-Officer Jean Vicquemare rushes down the Precinct stairs, umbrella in hand. It's unopened. He doesn't seem pleased about the spring rain.

links.title: Esprit de Corps: "On the bridge, Officers Torson and..."
links.text: On the bridge, Officers Torson and McLaine are standing guard. Torson wears jeans and a fishnet wifebeater. Satellite-Officer Vicquemare passes by, and the young man remarks to him...

links.title: Mack Torson: ""Where's your homo, homey?""
links.text: "Where's your homo, homey?"

links.title: Jean Vicquemare: ""What?""
links.text: "What?"

links.title: Chester McLaine: ""It's not like that. They're what y..."
links.text: "It's not like that. They're what you call *hetero-sexual life partners*. They have a battle-tested relationship. A 'bröderbund', if you will."

links.title: Jean Vicquemare: ""Huh? Yeah." He opens his umbrella,..."
links.text: "Huh? Yeah." He opens his umbrella, but the wind immediately turns it inside out.

links.title: Mack Torson: ""Hetero -- sexual. Life -- partners.""
links.text: "Hetero -- sexual. Life -- partners."

links.title: Jean Vicquemare: ""Funny apery." Vicquemare struggles..."
links.text: "Funny apery." Vicquemare struggles with his umbrella, the ribs are protruding from its canopy. "Male-centric workplace humour. Have you seen him?"

links.title: Mack Torson: ""Is there something wrong?""
links.text: "Is there something wrong?"

links.title: Jean Vicquemare: ""No, nothing. It's just... Judit we..."
links.text: "No, nothing. It's just... Judit went to his place and found the Monday mail unopened. I think he's still *there*. You didn't, like, drink with him over the weekend did you?"

links.title: Chester McLaine: ""That would be *irresponsible*.""
links.text: "That would be *irresponsible*."

links.title: Mack Torson: ""With that animal? Never again, man..."
links.text: "With that animal? Never again, man. What, is he still down there, in... you know, south of the interchange? The... what was it?"

links.title: Jean Vicquemare: ""In Martinaise. He's in Martinaise.""
links.text: "In Martinaise. He's in Martinaise."

links.title: Esprit de Corps: "It's the only home you have now. Bu..."
links.text: It's the only home you have now. But you can't go back. Not like this.

links.title: Mack Torson: ""Wonder if Vic's found his long los..."
links.text: "Wonder if Vic's found his long lost boyfriend yet." He looks over at Chester McLaine and breaks into a laugh at his own joke. The rain falls outside.

links.title: Chester McLaine: ""Mack, they're *hetero-sexual life..."
links.text: "Mack, they're *hetero-sexual life partners*. It's not like that," his partner smirks. "But yeah. There's trouble in paradise for that duo, Tequila Sunset has..." The sound of the rain grows so loud it drowns out his voice.

links.title: Shivers: "Your vision blurs. You wipe your fa..."
links.text: Your vision blurs. You wipe your face with your hand. The rain stings your eyes, making you look up and blink.

links.title: You: "What is Jamrock?"
links.text: What is Jamrock?

links.title: Shivers: "Revachol is the capital of the worl..."
links.text: Revachol is the capital of the world. Jamrock is the capital of Revachol. Droplets form on your eyelashes.

links.title: Inland Empire: "It's home."
links.text: It's home.

links.title: You: "What's above?"
links.text: What's above?

links.title: Shivers: "More coalition aerostatics. Way up..."
links.text: More coalition aerostatics. Way up there -- where rain forms -- rotors flutter silently. Your sight clears.

links.title: Shivers: "Coalition aerostatics hang like app..."
links.text: Coalition aerostatics hang like apparitions under the cloud cover. Way up there -- where rain forms -- rotors flutter silently. Your sight clears.

links.title: You: "What's below?"
links.text: What's below?

links.title: Shivers: "Collapsed storm drains. Old sewage..."
links.text: Collapsed storm drains. Old sewage systems flooded with rainwater. Hidden weapon caches from the Revolution. Doors leading down to Le Royaume -- the catacombs to which, for three centuries, they delivered the blue-blooded dead.

links.title: You: ""Motherfucker." [Finish thought.]"
links.text: "Motherfucker." [Finish thought.]

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""This rain will not let up any time..."
links.text: "This rain will not let up any time soon. At least we're dressed for it -- let's keep moving."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""This rain will not let up any time..."
links.text: "This rain will not let up any time soon. I'd recommend you put on your coat."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""This rain will not let up any time..."
links.text: "This rain will not let up any time soon. You should get a raincoat. There's a Frittte to the east. They sell them there."

links.title: Shivers: "These spring thaw will not last. Th..."
links.text: These spring thaw will not last. The winter will return to Revachol.

links.title: Shivers: "Your shirt sticks to your chest. Th..."
links.text: Your shirt sticks to your chest. The shoulders of your disco blazer grow heavy. The cold finds its way in under your skin. You shiver, and the city shivers with you.

links.title: Composure: "You're not dressed for this weather..."
links.text: You're not dressed for this weather. You should get an overcoat, or a patrol cloak.

links.title: Shivers: "Your shirt sticks to your chest. Th..."
links.text: Your shirt sticks to your chest. The shoulders of your jacket grow heavy. The cold finds its way under your skin. You shiver, and the city shivers with you.

links.title: Shivers: "Your shirt sticks to your chest. Th..."
links.text: Your shirt sticks to your chest. The cold finds its way under your skin. You shiver, and the city shivers with you.

links.title: Shivers: "The shoulders of your jacket grow h..."
links.text: The shoulders of your jacket grow heavy. The cold finds its way under your skin. You shiver, and the city shivers with you.

links.title: Shivers: "Water runs down your bare chest. Th..."
links.text: Water runs down your bare chest. The cold finds its way under your skin. You shiver, and the city shivers with you.

links.title: You: "Shake the shivers off. [Discard tho..."
links.text: Shake the shivers off. [Discard thought.]

links.title: Shivers: "The spring thaw must be here. The s..."
links.text: The spring thaw must be here. The snow is melting...

links.title: You: "What am I doing?"
links.text: What am I doing?

links.title: Shivers: "Looking up at the sky, cold water d..."
links.text: Looking up at the sky, cold water dripping from your hair.

links.title: You: "What do I see?"
links.text: What do I see?

links.title: Shivers: "Grey sky like great battleships, cl..."
links.text: Grey sky like great battleships, clouds colliding with one another. Rain falls down on the world.

links.title: You: "How does it feel?"
links.text: How does it feel?
